description: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

serviceArea.description: The geographic area where the service is provided.

produces.description: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

serviceAudience.description: The audience eligible for this service.

areaServed.description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

audience.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

hasOfferCatalog.description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

hoursAvailable.description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

providerMobility.description: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g.  static ,  dynamic ).

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

award.description: An award won by or for this item.

category.description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

broker.description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

serviceOutput.description: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

isSimilarTo.description: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

isRelatedTo.description: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

availableChannel.description: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

serviceType.description: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans  benefits, emergency relief, etc.

brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item s identity. E.g. the URL of the item s Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the  typeof  attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an  object  role.

mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.

disambiguatingDescription.description: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
